name: InterContinental Manila

reviews.text: The hotel is in a great location as far as Manila has some. Unlike the Oriental Mandarin you can leave the hotel and set your foot directly in a big shopping mall or a clean and high standard supermarket. But the rooms are quite worn down and the bathroom is dirty. On the otherhand the pool is great and a nice place to spend your evening (open till 10 p.m.) in a little green place. Breakfast is disappointing. The variety is not to big but what upsetted me, is that the food look old. The cold cuts are bend and smelly.
reviews.title: Location is great the rest is just standard

reviews.text: Been here countless times for business trips and I really like this hotel. Though its not as sophisticated as the Peninsula just a few hundred meters away, I still go here everytime I am in Manila.
reviews.title: Not really 5* but excellent location and great service

likes.disliked: — Batrooms could well receiv a renovation

reviews.text: First of all it is perfectly located, next to the big shopping mall Glorietta, Rustans, S&M and Greenbelt where you can go for dining, drinking and shopping of course.
reviews.title: no special treatment

reviews.text: The staff is very friendly, there is great lounge on the top floor with excellent little offerings for tea and blue hour (executive floor only).
reviews.title: Location ! Location ! Location ! and that's all !

reviews.text: Breakfast is very good, a huge selection of everything you can think of. Especially good is the fresh mango.
reviews.title: Reasonable value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: my partner and i stayed at intercontinental makati for 9 nights. we were planning on staying in prince plaza but could not sleep after just 2 nights ( but that's another story) so we opted for a better but more expensive hotel.
reviews.title: perfect location - average

reviews.text: upon our arrival the concierge was 'amazed' that we were staying for that amount of time. and informed us for only US$20 more per night, we could get upgraded to the business room or whatever they call it. i asked how big is the room in difference and she said it was much more bigger. unfortunately i did not have a look at what we originally booked for. so we decided to go ahead and be 'upgraded'. this upgrade allowed us entry to the club lounge on the top floor, buffet breakfast for 2, bottled water and newspaper everyday. the bed wasn't the comfiest bed ive ever slept in and i think at that time since it was off peak, they were doing some construction which was pretty noisy.
reviews.title: Manila Haven

reviews.text: anyway, by the end of our stay, i paid using my credit card and it came to a total of around P73k. i didn't calculate it at the time or look at my statement (my bad). but we were in a hurry for the airport and it was a good 7 pages long. it wasn't until i sat in the plane that i calculated the enormous tax PER NIGHT. (you must look at that before you go ahead and book your stay esp. when they say 'plus plus' - exactly how much that plus plus is.). it was only suppose to be US$130 per night. (which i estimate around AU$150 ish or less) per night. after the tax(es), it ended up to be AU$215 PER NIGHT. i know it's a whole lot cheaper than staying per night let's say in sydney australia. but this was not cheap for philippines! that's like AU$65 extra for tax per night. omg i almost died.
reviews.title: If you want good sleep, do not stay in InterContinental Manila

likes.liked: — The dinner room staffs were very friendly and unlike the other staffs

reviews.text: on top of that, they overcharged us an extra $180 or so for the buffet breakfast. breakfast was good, but $180 for breakfast? hell no. i immediately phoned them when i got back to sydney. it took around 2 weeks to get my money back. and it was only when i emailed the manager ken kapulong that i would not suggest this hotel to anyone ever that i got my money back...
reviews.title: Average Compared to other Intercon Hotel in the Region

likes.disliked: — Rood standard old and due to major upgrade

reviews.text: intercontinental makati is a superb location if it's your first time in manila/makati (like us). its literally right next door to the major shopping centres and everything else.
reviews.title: Superb Hotel with Excellent Service

likes.liked: — Comfy room, top-notch service, quiet, accessible to shopping and restaurants.

reviews.title: Go here for the location and the service, then the amenities
reviews.text: The lobby is pristine as is the club on the 14th floor. The rooms are updated but show their age in such things as older bathroom fixtures, difficult sliding closet doors, and cracking paint. Still, the beds had me sleeping without a problem and the bathroom has telephone access and in there you can blast whatever channel you've selected on the tv (I got used to the repetitive, classical, 1 song soundtrack that plays on the hotel's channel 63 (or is it 64?) - what's the name of that song???)
The service is outstanding. Please tip generously to express your satisfaction.
reviews.title: A Good Option In Makati Area

likes.liked: — Special assistance by housekeeping staff ; Strategic location

reviews.title: Left wanting more, sadly
reviews.text: The location is central to Glorietta, Rustans, Landmark, Greenbelt, SM. In other words, everything commercial
There's an LRT (or is it MRT?) train next door.
reviews.title: Good Location

reviews.text: You can take a 10 minute walk to Greenbelt Chapel for a 745AM or 545PM Mass.
reviews.title: I found my home away from home in Manila

likes.liked: — Service and the simple but solid accomodations

reviews.text: Another 3 week stay here - and again I am more than happy. As a Royal Ambassador I was upgraded to a State Suite which was faultless - more of an apartment really with a private sauna, jacuzzi, dining room, living room, kitchenette and very big bedroom. My home from home in Manila - will be back again in Jan and wouldn't dream of staying anywhere else. I would really recommend this hotel - the service is faultless.
reviews.title: Another happy stay :o)

description: A LANDMARK HOTEL IN THE PHILIPPINES' PREMIERE METROPOLIS. Designed by National Artist Leandro Locsin, InterContinental Manila is a symbol of pride in the Philippines' premier financial and commercial hub-Makati City. The hotel is across the Greenbelt and Glorietta shopping and entertainment districts and is easily accessible from Ninoy Aquino International Airport. Our 332 guestrooms and suites boast every comfort for an enjoyable and unforgettable visit. The latest technology including in-room high speed Internet access and Wi-Fi in public spaces is sure to please business or leisure travellers. For guests looking for extra space and added comfort, our Club InterContinental rooms are available and offer special privileges such as a Club Lounge for private check-in and check-out, sumptuous breakfast, afternoon tea service, evening cocktails and a selection of international newspapers and magazines. The Club InterContinental Lounge at the top floor offers a breathtaking view of Makati and the nearby Bonifacio Global City. InterContinental Manila offers one of the largest conference and meeting facilities in the city and has a well-established reputation for delivering the highest standards of excellence. For leisure time, we recommend a visit to the nearby Ayala Museum and the walled city of Intramuros. The island fortress of Corregidor is also a worthwhile outing.
